info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 4:02PM EDT until August 03 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Clinton County in northern New York... Central Franklin County in northern New York... Northwestern Essex County in northern New York... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 401 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Regis Mountain, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Madawaska, North Elba, Harrietstown, Paul Smiths, Union Falls, Saranac Inn, Ray Brook, Gabriels, Lake Clear, Upper Saint Regis, St. Regis Mountain, Upper St. Regis, Hawkeye, Lake Colby, Rainbow Lake, Loon Lake, and Onchiota. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
